trans-unit.target: Devuelve el target con la sección designada por path reemplazada por new_value , o con new_value agregado si create_missing es verdadero (el valor predeterminado es true ) y el elemento designado por path no existe. Al igual que con los operadores orientados a la ruta, los enteros negativos que aparecen en la path cuentan desde el final de las matrices JSON.

trans-unit.source: Returns true if its arguments have a similarity that is greater than the current similarity threshold set by pg_trgm.similarity_threshold.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve true si sus argumentos tienen una similitud mayor que el umbral de similitud actual establecido por pg_trgm.similarity_threshold .

trans-unit.source: Returns true if its second argument has a continuous extent of an ordered trigram set that matches word boundaries, and its similarity to the trigram set of the first argument is greater than the current strict word similarity threshold set by the pg_trgm.strict_word_similarity_threshold parameter.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve true si su segundo argumento tiene una extensión continua de un conjunto de trigramas ordenado que coincide con los límites de palabras, y su similitud con el conjunto de trigramas del primer argumento es mayor que el umbral de similitud de palabras estricto actual establecido por el parámetro pg_trgm.strict_word_similarity_threshold .

trans-unit.source: Returns true if the similarity between the trigram set in the first argument and a continuous extent of an ordered trigram set in the second argument is greater than the current word similarity threshold set by pg_trgm.word_similarity_threshold parameter.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve true si la similitud entre el trigrama establecido en el primer argumento y una extensión continua de un trigrama ordenado establecido en el segundo argumento es mayor que el umbral de similitud de palabras actual establecido por el parámetro pg_trgm.word_similarity_threshold .

trans-unit.source: Returns count cryptographically strong random bytes. At most 1024 bytes can be extracted at a time. This is to avoid draining the randomness generator pool.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el count bytes aleatorios criptográficamente fuertes. Se pueden extraer como máximo 1024 bytes a la vez. Esto es para evitar agotar el grupo de generadores de aleatoriedad.

trans-unit.source: Returns target with new_value inserted. If the item designated by the path is an array element, new_value will be inserted before that item if insert_after is false (which is the default), or after it if insert_after is true. If the item designated by the path is an object field, new_value will be inserted only if the object does not already contain that key. All earlier steps in the path must exist, or the target is returned unchanged. As with the path oriented operators, negative integers that appear in the path count from the end of JSON arrays. If the last path step is an array index that is out of range, the new value is added at the beginning of the array if the index is negative, or at the end of the array if it is positive.

Returns target with the item designated by path replaced by new_value, or with new_value added if create_if_missing is true (which is the default) and the item designated by path does not exist. All earlier steps in the path must exist, or the target is returned unchanged. As with the path oriented operators, negative integers that appear in the path count from the end of JSON arrays. If the last path step is an array index that is out of range, and create_if_missing is true, the new value is added at the beginning of the array if the index is negative, or at the end of the array if it is positive.

Returns value evaluated at the row that is offset rows after the current row within the partition; if there is no such row, instead returns default (which must be of the same type as value). Both offset and default are evaluated with respect to the current row. If omitted, offset defaults to 1 and default to NULL.

Returns value evaluated at the row that is offset rows before the current row within the partition; if there is no such row, instead returns default (which must be of the same type as value). Both offset and default are evaluated with respect to the current row. If omitted, offset defaults to 1 and default to NULL.
Returns value evaluated at the row that is the n'th row of the window frame (counting from 1); returns NULL if there is no such row.
Returns value evaluated at the row that is the first row of the window frame.
Returns value evaluated at the row that is the last row of the window frame.
Returns JSON value pointed to by path_elems (equivalent to #> operator).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el valor JSON al que apunta path_elems (equivalente al operador #> ).

trans-unit.source: Returns JSON value pointed to by path_elems as text (equivalent to #>> operator).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el valor JSON señalado por path_elems como text o (equivalente al operador #>> ).

trans-unit.source: Returns a “nil” UUID constant, which does not occur as a real UUID.

Returns a bit mask indicating which GROUP BY expressions are not included in the current grouping set. Bits are assigned with the rightmost argument corresponding to the least-significant bit; each bit is 0 if the corresponding expression is included in the grouping criteria of the grouping set generating the current result row, and 1 if it is not included.

Returns a box suitable for an indexed search using the cube@> operator for points within a given great circle distance of a location. Some points in this box are further than the specified great circle distance from the location, so a second check using earth_distance should be included in the query.

Returns a box suitable for an indexed search using the cube @> operator for points within a given great circle distance of a location. Some points in this box are further than the specified great circle distance from the location, so a second check using earth_distance should be included in the query.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un cuadro adecuado para una búsqueda indexada utilizando el operador cube @> para puntos dentro de una distancia dada de un gran círculo de una ubicación. Algunos puntos en este cuadro están más lejos que la distancia del gran círculo especificada desde la ubicación, por lo que se debe incluir una segunda verificación utilizando earth_distance en la consulta.

trans-unit.source: Returns a constant designating the DNS namespace for UUIDs.
Returns a constant designating the ISO object identifier (OID) namespace for UUIDs. (This pertains to ASN.1 OIDs, which are unrelated to the OIDs used in PostgreSQL.)
Returns a constant designating the URL namespace for UUIDs.
Returns a constant designating the X.500 distinguished name (DN) namespace for UUIDs.
Returns a current snapshot, a data structure showing which transaction IDs are now in-progress.

Returns a number that indicates how similar the two arguments are. The range of the result is zero (indicating that the two strings are completely dissimilar) to one (indicating that the two strings are identical).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un número que indica cuán similares son los dos argumentos.El rango del resultado es de cero (indicando que las dos cadenas son completamente diferentes)a uno (indicando que las dos cadenas son idénticas).

trans-unit.source: Returns a number that indicates the greatest similarity between the set of trigrams in the first string and any continuous extent of an ordered set of trigrams in the second string. For details, see the explanation below.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un número que indica la mayor similitud entre el conjunto de trigramas de la primera cadena y cualquier extensión continua de un conjunto ordenado de trigramas de la segunda cadena.Para más detalles,véase la explicación a continuación.

trans-unit.source: Returns a palloc'd array of keys given a value to be queried; that is, query is the value on the right-hand side of an indexable operator whose left-hand side is the indexed column. n is the strategy number of the operator within the operator class (see Section 37.16.2). Often, extractQuery will need to consult n to determine the data type of query and the method it should use to extract key values. The number of returned keys must be stored into *nkeys. If any of the keys can be null, also palloc an array of *nkeysbool fields, store its address at *nullFlags, and set these null flags as needed. *nullFlags can be left NULL (its initial value) if all keys are non-null. The return value can be NULL if the query contains no keys.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una matriz de claves pallocded dado un valor para ser consultado; es decir, query es el valor en el lado derecho de un operador indexable cuyo lado izquierdo es la columna indexada. n es el número de estrategia del operador dentro de la clase de operador (consulte la Sección 37.16.2 ). A menudo, extractQuery necesitará consultar n para determinar el tipo de datos de la query y el método que debe usar para extraer valores clave. El número de claves devueltas debe almacenarse en *nkeys . Si alguna de las claves puede ser nula, también coloque una matriz de campos bool de *nkeys , almacene su dirección en *nullFlags y establezca estos indicadores nulos según sea necesario. *nullFlags se puede dejar NULL (su valor inicial) si todas las claves no son nulas. El valor de retorno puede ser NULL si la query no contiene claves.

trans-unit.source: Returns a palloc'd array of keys given a value to be queried; that is, query is the value on the right-hand side of an indexable operator whose left-hand side is the indexed column. n is the strategy number of the operator within the operator class (see Section 37.16.2). Often, extractQuery will need to consult n to determine the data type of query and the method it should use to extract key values. The number of returned keys must be stored into *nkeys. If any of the keys can be null, also palloc an array of *nkeysbool fields, store its address at *nullFlags, and set these null flags as needed. *nullFlags can be left NULL (its initial value) if all keys are non-null. The return value can be NULL if the query contains no keys.

Returns a palloc'd array of keys given an item to be indexed. The number of returned keys must be stored into *nkeys. If any of the keys can be null, also palloc an array of *nkeysbool fields, store its address at *nullFlags, and set these null flags as needed. *nullFlags can be left NULL (its initial value) if all keys are non-null. The return value can be NULL if the item contains no keys.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una matriz de claves en palloc dado un elemento a indexar. El número de claves devueltas debe almacenarse en *nkeys . Si alguna de las claves puede ser nula, también coloque una matriz de campos bool *nkeys , almacene su dirección en *nullFlags y establezca estas banderas nulas según sea necesario. *nullFlags se puede dejar NULL (su valor inicial) si todas las claves no son nulas. El valor de retorno puede ser NULL si el elemento no contiene claves.

trans-unit.source: Returns a query that searches for a match to the first given query followed by a match to the second given query at a distance of at distance lexemes, using the <N>tsquery operator. For example:
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una consulta que busca una coincidencia con la primera consulta dada seguida de una coincidencia con la segunda consulta dada a una distancia de lexemas de distance , usando el operador <N> tsquery . Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Returns a query that searches for a match to the first given query followed by a match to the second given query at a distance of exactly distance lexemes, using the <N>tsquery operator. For example:
Returns a query that searches for a match to the first given query immediately followed by a match to the second given query, using the <-> (FOLLOWED BY) tsquery operator. For example:
trans-unit.target: Devuelve una consulta que busca una coincidencia con la primera consulta dada seguida inmediatamente por una coincidencia con la segunda consulta dada, usando el operador tsquery <-> ( SEGUIDA POR) . Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Returns a random value in the range 0.0 <= x < 1.0

Returns a record containing the file's size, last access time stamp, last modification time stamp, last file status change time stamp (Unix platforms only), file creation time stamp (Windows only), and a flag indicating if it is a directory.

Returns a record of information about the backend with the specified PID, or one record for each active backend in the system if NULL is specified. The fields returned are a subset of those in the pg_stat_activity view.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un registro de información sobre el backend con el PID especificado, o un registro para cada backend activo en el sistema si se especifica NULL . Los campos devueltos son un subconjunto de los de la vista pg_stat_activity .

trans-unit.source: Returns a record of information about the backend with the specified process ID, or one record for each active backend in the system if NULL is specified. The fields returned are a subset of those in the pg_stat_activity view.

Returns a relation's OID given the tablespace OID and filenode it is stored under. This is essentially the inverse mapping of pg_relation_filepath. For a relation in the database's default tablespace, the tablespace can be specified as zero. Returns NULL if no relation in the current database is associated with the given values.
Returns a role's name given its OID.

Returns a row containing enough information to uniquely identify the database object specified by a type code and object name and argument arrays. The returned values are the ones that would be used in system catalogs such as pg_depend; they can be passed to other system functions such as pg_describe_object or pg_identify_object. classid is the OID of the system catalog containing the object; objid is the OID of the object itself, and objsubid is the sub-object ID, or zero if none. This function is the inverse of pg_identify_object_as_address.

Returns a row containing enough information to uniquely identify the database object specified by catalog OID, object OID and sub-object ID. The returned information is independent of the current server, that is, it could be used to identify an identically named object in another server. type identifies the type of database object; object_names and object_args are text arrays that together form a reference to the object. These three values can be passed to pg_get_object_address to obtain the internal address of the object.

Returns a row containing enough information to uniquely identify the database object specified by catalog OID, object OID and sub-object ID. This information is intended to be machine-readable, and is never translated. type identifies the type of database object; schema is the schema name that the object belongs in, or NULL for object types that do not belong to schemas; name is the name of the object, quoted if necessary, if the name (along with schema name, if pertinent) is sufficient to uniquely identify the object, otherwise NULL; identity is the complete object identity, with the precise format depending on object type, and each name within the format being schema-qualified and quoted as necessary.

Returns a set of records describing the SQL keywords recognized by the server. The word column contains the keyword. The catcode column contains a category code: U for an unreserved keyword, C for a keyword that can be a column name, T for a keyword that can be a type or function name, or R for a fully reserved keyword. The catdesc column contains a possibly-localized string describing the category.

Returns a string describing the PostgreSQL server's version. You can also get this information from server_version, or for a machine-readable version use server_version_num. Software developers should use server_version_num (available since 8.2) or PQserverVersion instead of parsing the text version.
Returns a table that describes each type of token a parser specified by OID can recognize. See Section 12.8.2 for details.
Returns a table that describes each type of token the named parser can recognize. See Section 12.8.2 for details.
Returns a text representation of the array's dimensions.

Returns a textual description of a database object identified by catalog OID, object OID, and sub-object ID (such as a column number within a table; the sub-object ID is zero when referring to a whole object). This description is intended to be human-readable, and might be translated, depending on server configuration. This is especially useful to determine the identity of an object referenced in the pg_depend catalog.

Returns a value indicating the “cost” of inserting the new entry into a particular branch of the tree. Items will be inserted down the path of least penalty in the tree. Values returned by penalty should be non-negative. If a negative value is returned, it will be treated as zero.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un valor que indica el "costo" de insertar la nueva entrada en una rama particular del árbol. Los elementos se insertarán en la ruta de menor penalty del árbol. Los valores devueltos por penalty deben ser negativos. Si se devuelve un valor negativo, se tratará como cero.

trans-unit.source: Returns a vector that lists the same lexemes as the given vector, but lacks any position or weight information. The result is usually much smaller than an unstripped vector, but it is also less useful. Relevance ranking does not work as well on stripped vectors as unstripped ones. Also, the <-> (FOLLOWED BY) tsquery operator will never match stripped input, since it cannot determine the distance between lexeme occurrences.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un vector que enumera los mismos lexemas que el vector dado, pero carece de información sobre la posición o el peso. El resultado suele ser mucho más pequeño que un vector sin eliminar, pero también es menos útil. La clasificación de relevancia no funciona tan bien en los vectores eliminados como en los no eliminados. Además, el operador tsquery <-> ( SEGUIDO POR) nunca coincidirá con la entrada eliminada, ya que no puede determinar la distancia entre las ocurrencias del lexema.

trans-unit.source: Returns a version 4 (random) UUID.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un UUID versión 4 (aleatorio).

trans-unit.source: Returns a version 4 (random) UUID. (Obsolete, this function is now also included in core PostgreSQL.)
Returns all JSON items returned by the JSON path for the specified JSON value, as a JSON array. The optional vars and silent arguments act the same as for jsonb_path_exists.
Returns all JSON items returned by the JSON path for the specified JSON value. The optional vars and silent arguments act the same as for jsonb_path_exists.

Returns all or part of a file. This function is identical to pg_read_file except that it can read arbitrary binary data, returning the result as bytea not text; accordingly, no encoding checks are performed.

Returns all or part of a text file, starting at the given byte offset, returning at most length bytes (less if the end of file is reached first). If offset is negative, it is relative to the end of the file. If offset and length are omitted, the entire file is returned. The bytes read from the file are interpreted as a string in the database's encoding; an error is thrown if they are not valid in that encoding.
Returns all values of the input enum type in an ordered array
trans-unit.target: Devuelve todos los valores del tipo de entrada enum en una matriz ordenada

trans-unit.source: Returns all values of the input enum type in an ordered array.

Returns an array filled with copies of the given value, having dimensions of the lengths specified by the second argument. The optional third argument supplies lower-bound values for each dimension (which default to all 1).
Returns an array of all the trigrams in the given string. (In practice this is seldom useful except for debugging.)
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un conjunto de todos los trigramas de la cadena dada.(En la práctica esto rara vez es útil excepto para la depuración).

trans-unit.source: Returns an array of replacement lexemes if the input token is known to the dictionary, or an empty array if the token is known to the dictionary but it is a stop word, or NULL if it is not a known word. See Section 12.8.3 for details.

Returns an array of the names of all schemas presently in the effective search path, in their priority order. (Items in the current search_path setting that do not correspond to existing, searchable schemas are omitted.) If the Boolean argument is true, then implicitly-searched system schemas such as pg_catalog are included in the result.

Returns an array of the process ID(s) of the sessions that are blocking the server process with the specified process ID from acquiring a lock, or an empty array if there is no such server process or it is not blocked.

Returns an array of the process ID(s) of the sessions that are blocking the server process with the specified process ID from acquiring a safe snapshot, or an empty array if there is no such server process or it is not blocked.

Returns an array of the subscripts of all occurrences of the second argument in the array given as first argument. The array must be one-dimensional. Comparisons are done using IS NOT DISTINCT FROM semantics, so it is possible to search for NULL. NULL is returned only if the array is NULL; if the value is not found in the array, an empty array is returned.
Returns an integer ranging from 1 to the argument value, dividing the partition as equally as possible.
Returns captured substring(s) resulting from matching a POSIX regular expression to the string; see Section 9.7.3.
Returns captured substring(s) resulting from the first match of a POSIX regular expression to the string; see Section 9.7.3.

Returns changes in the slot slot_name, starting from the point at which since changes have been consumed last. If upto_lsn and upto_nchanges are NULL, logical decoding will continue until end of WAL. If upto_lsn is non-NULL, decoding will include only those transactions which commit prior to the specified LSN. If upto_nchanges is non-NULL, decoding will stop when the number of rows produced by decoding exceeds the specified value. Note, however, that the actual number of rows returned may be larger, since this limit is only checked after adding the rows produced when decoding each new transaction commit.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los cambios en la ranura slot_name , comenzando desde el punto en el que se consumieron los últimos cambios. Si upto_lsn y upto_nchanges son NULL, la decodificación lógica continuará hasta el final de WAL. Si upto_lsn no es NULL, la decodificación incluirá solo aquellas transacciones que se confirman antes del LSN especificado. Si upto_nchanges no es NULL, la decodificación se detendrá cuando el número de filas producidas por la decodificación supere el valor especificado. Sin embargo, tenga en cuenta que el número real de filas devueltas puede ser mayor, ya que este límite solo se verifica después de agregar las filas producidas al decodificar cada nueva transacción confirmada.

trans-unit.source: Returns changes in the slot slot_name, starting from the point from which changes have been consumed last. If upto_lsn and upto_nchanges are NULL, logical decoding will continue until end of WAL. If upto_lsn is non-NULL, decoding will include only those transactions which commit prior to the specified LSN. If upto_nchanges is non-NULL, decoding will stop when the number of rows produced by decoding exceeds the specified value. Note, however, that the actual number of rows returned may be larger, since this limit is only checked after adding the rows produced when decoding each new transaction commit.
Returns current client encoding name.
Returns first n characters in the string, or when n is negative, returns all but last |n| characters.
Returns first array entry that is a descendant of ltree, or NULL if none.
Returns first array entry that is an ancestor of ltree, or NULL if none.
Returns first array entry that matches lquery, or NULL if none.
Returns first array entry that matches ltxtquery, or NULL if none.
Returns index of the first array element matching item, or 0 if no match.
Returns index of the first array element matching the right argument, or 0 if no match. (Same as idx function.)
Returns information about cluster initialization state, as shown in Table 9.81.
Returns information about cluster initialization state.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve información sobre el estado de inicialización de los grupos.

trans-unit.source: Returns information about current checkpoint state, as shown in Table 9.79.
Returns information about current checkpoint state.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve información sobre el estado actual del puesto de control.

trans-unit.source: Returns information about current control file state, as shown in Table 9.80.
Returns information about current control file state.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve información sobre el estado actual del archivo de control.

trans-unit.source: Returns information about recovery state, as shown in Table 9.82.
Returns information about recovery state.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve información sobre el estado de recuperación.

trans-unit.source: Returns internal information about the indexed columns' summary data. The return value must point to a palloc'd BrinOpcInfo, which has this definition:
trans-unit.target: Devuelve información interna sobre los datos de resumen de las columnas indexadas. El valor de retorno debe apuntar a un BrinOpcInfo BrinOpcInfo , que tiene esta definición:

trans-unit.source: Returns last n characters in the string, or when n is negative, returns all but first |n| characters.
Returns number of bits in the binary string (8 times the octet_length).
Returns number of bits in the bit string.
Returns number of bits in the string (8 times the octet_length).
Returns number of bytes in the binary string.
Returns number of bytes in the bit string.
Returns number of bytes in the string.
Returns number of bytes in the string. Since this version of the function accepts type character directly, it will not strip trailing spaces.
Returns number of characters in the string.
Returns number of labels in path.
Returns position of first occurrence of b in a, or -1 if not found.
Returns position of first occurrence of b in a, or -1 if not found. The search starts at position offset; negative offset means start -offset labels from the end of the path.

Returns serial number of current client certificate. The combination of certificate serial number and certificate issuer is guaranteed to uniquely identify a certificate (but not its owner — the owner ought to regularly change their keys, and get new certificates from the issuer).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el número de serie del certificado de cliente actual. Se garantiza que la combinación del número de serie del certificado y el emisor del certificado identificará de forma única un certificado (pero no a su propietario; el propietario debe cambiar periódicamente sus claves y obtener nuevos certificados del emisor).

trans-unit.source: Returns set of keys in the outermost JSON object.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve un juego de llaves en el objeto JSON más exterior.

trans-unit.source: Returns set of nodes (branches) to follow during tree search.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el conjunto de nodos (ramas)a seguir durante la búsqueda de árboles.

trans-unit.source: Returns starting index of specified substring within bits, or zero if it's not present.
Returns starting index of specified substring within bytes, or zero if it's not present.
Returns starting index of specified substring within string, or zero if it's not present.
Returns starting index of specified substring within string, or zero if it's not present. (Same as position(substring in string), but note the reversed argument order.)
Returns static information about the index implementation, including the data type OIDs of the prefix and node label data types.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve información estática sobre la implementación del índice,incluyendo el tipo de datos OID del prefijo y los tipos de datos de la etiqueta del nodo.

trans-unit.source: Returns subpath of ltree from position start to position end-1 (counting from 0).
Returns subpath of ltree starting at position offset, extending to end of path. If offset is negative, subpath starts that far from the end of the path.

Returns subpath of ltree starting at position offset, with length len. If offset is negative, subpath starts that far from the end of the path. If len is negative, leaves that many labels off the end of the path.
Returns the “distance” between the arguments, that is one minus the similarity() value.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la "distancia" entre los argumentos, es decir, uno menos el valor de similarity() .

trans-unit.source: Returns the “distance” between the arguments, that is one minus the strict_word_similarity() value.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la "distancia" entre los argumentos, es decir, uno menos el valor strict_word_similarity() .

trans-unit.source: Returns the “distance” between the arguments, that is one minus the word_similarity() value.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la "distancia" entre los argumentos, es decir, uno menos el valor de word_similarity() .

trans-unit.source: Returns the “filenode” number currently assigned to the specified relation. The filenode is the base component of the file name(s) used for the relation (see Section 68.1 for more information). For most relations the result is the same as pg_class.relfilenode, but for certain system catalogs relfilenode is zero and this function must be used to get the correct value. The function returns NULL if passed a relation that does not have storage, such as a view.

Returns the aclitem array as a set of rows. If the grantee is the pseudo-role PUBLIC, it is represented by zero in the grantee column. Each granted privilege is represented as SELECT, INSERT, etc. Note that each privilege is broken out as a separate row, so only one keyword appears in the privilege_type column.
Returns the n-th coordinate value for the lower left corner of the cube.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el valor de la coordenada n -ésima para la esquina inferior izquierda del cubo.

trans-unit.source: Returns the n-th coordinate value for the upper right corner of the cube.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el valor de la coordenada n -ésima para la esquina superior derecha del cubo.

trans-unit.source: Returns the xmax of a snapshot.
Returns the xmin of a snapshot.
Returns the n-th coordinate value for the lower left corner of the cube.
Returns the n-th coordinate value for the upper right corner of the cube.
Returns the AND-combination of the two given queries.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la combinación Y de las dos consultas dadas.

trans-unit.source: Returns the IP address as text, ignoring the netmask.
Returns the IP address of the client connected to this backend.
Returns the IP address of the current client, or NULL if the current connection is via a Unix-domain socket.
Returns the IP address on which the server accepted the current connection, or NULL if the current connection is via a Unix-domain socket.
Returns the IP port number of the current client, or NULL if the current connection is via a Unix-domain socket.
Returns the IP port number on which the server accepted the current connection, or NULL if the current connection is via a Unix-domain socket.
Returns the OID of the current default text search configuration (as set by default_text_search_config).
Returns the OID of the current session's temporary schema, or zero if it has none (because it has not created any temporary tables).

Returns the OID of the data type of the value that is passed to it. This can be helpful for troubleshooting or dynamically constructing SQL queries. The function is declared as returning regtype, which is an OID alias type (see Section 8.19); this means that it is the same as an OID for comparison purposes but displays as a type name.
Returns the OID of the database this backend is connected to.
Returns the OID of the user logged into this backend.
Returns the OR-combination of the two given queries.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la combinación del quirófano de las dos consultas dadas.

trans-unit.source: Returns the SQL name for a data type that is identified by its type OID and possibly a type modifier. Pass NULL for the type modifier if no specific modifier is known.
Returns the TCP port number that the client is using for communication.
Returns the TIDs of non-all-visible tuples stored in pages marked all-visible in the visibility map. If this function returns a non-empty set of TIDs, the visibility map is corrupt.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los TID de las tuplas no visibles almacenadas en las páginas marcadas como "todo visible" en el mapa de visibilidad.Si esta función devuelve un conjunto no vacío de TIDs,el mapa de visibilidad está corrupto.

trans-unit.source: Returns the TIDs of non-frozen tuples stored in pages marked all-frozen in the visibility map. If this function returns a non-empty set of TIDs, the visibility map is corrupt.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los TID de las tuplas no congeladas almacenadas en las páginas marcadas como todas congeladas en el mapa de visibilidad.Si esta función devuelve un conjunto de TIDs no vacíos,el mapa de visibilidad está corrupto.

trans-unit.source: Returns the actual version of the collation object as it is currently installed in the operating system. If this is different from the value in pg_collation.collversion, then objects depending on the collation might need to be rebuilt. See also ALTER COLLATION.
Returns the address's family: 4 for IPv4, 6 for IPv6.
Returns the all-visible and all-frozen bits in the visibility map for each block of the given relation, plus the PD_ALL_VISIBLE bit of each block.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los bits totalmente visibles y totalmente congelados en el mapa de visibilidad para cada bloque de la relación dada, más el bit PD_ALL_VISIBLE de cada bloque.

trans-unit.source: Returns the all-visible and all-frozen bits in the visibility map for each block of the given relation.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los bits totalmente visibles y totalmente congelados en el mapa de visibilidad para cada bloque de la relación dada.

trans-unit.source: Returns the all-visible and all-frozen bits in the visibility map for the given block of the given relation, plus the PD_ALL_VISIBLE bit of that block.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los bits totalmente visibles y totalmente congelados en el mapa de visibilidad para el bloque dado de la relación dada, más el bit PD_ALL_VISIBLE de ese bloque.

trans-unit.source: Returns the all-visible and all-frozen bits in the visibility map for the given block of the given relation.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve los bits totalmente visibles y totalmente congelados en el mapa de visibilidad para el bloque dado de la relación dada.

trans-unit.source: Returns the amount of free space on the page of the relation, specified by blkno, according to the FSM.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la cantidad de espacio libre en la página de la relación, especificada por blkno , según el FSM.

trans-unit.source: Returns the array as a JSON array. A PostgreSQL multidimensional array becomes a JSON array of arrays. Line feeds will be added between dimension-1 elements if pretty_bool is true.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la matriz como una matriz JSON. Una matriz multidimensional de PostgreSQL se convierte en una matriz JSON de matrices. Los avances de línea se agregarán entre los elementos de dimensión 1 si pretty_bool es verdadero.

trans-unit.source: Returns the assumed radius of the Earth.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el radio asumido de la Tierra.

trans-unit.source: Returns the character with the given code. In UTF8 encoding the argument is treated as a Unicode code point. In other multibyte encodings the argument must designate an ASCII character. chr(0) is disallowed because text data types cannot store that character.
Returns the client domain, the current security label of the client.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el dominio del cliente,la etiqueta de seguridad actual del cliente.

trans-unit.source: Returns the comment for a database object specified by its OID alone. This is deprecated since there is no guarantee that OIDs are unique across different system catalogs; therefore, the wrong comment might be returned.

Returns the comment for a database object specified by its OID and the name of the containing system catalog. For example, obj_description(123456, 'pg_class') would retrieve the comment for the table with OID 123456.

Returns the comment for a shared database object specified by its OID and the name of the containing system catalog. This is just like obj_description except that it is used for retrieving comments on shared objects (that is, databases, roles, and tablespaces). Some system catalogs are global to all databases within each cluster, and the descriptions for objects in them are stored globally as well.

Returns the comment for a table column, which is specified by the OID of its table and its column number. (obj_description cannot be used for table columns, since columns do not have OIDs of their own.)
Returns the commit timestamp of a transaction.
Returns the cumulative distribution, that is (number of partition rows preceding or peers with current row) / (total partition rows). The value thus ranges from 1/N to 1.
Returns the current nesting level of PostgreSQL triggers (0 if not called, directly or indirectly, from inside a trigger).

Returns the current similarity threshold used by the % operator. This sets the minimum similarity between two words for them to be considered similar enough to be misspellings of each other, for example (deprecated).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el umbral de similitud actual utilizado por el operador % . Esto establece la similitud mínima entre dos palabras para que se consideren lo suficientemente similares como para ser errores ortográficos entre sí, por ejemplo (en desuso ).

trans-unit.source: Returns the current similarity threshold used by the % operator. This sets the minimum similarity between two words for them to be considered similar enough to be misspellings of each other, for example. (Deprecated; instead use SHOWpg_trgm.similarity_threshold.)
Returns the current status of the weak mode.
Returns the current transaction's ID, or NULL if no ID is assigned yet. (It's best to use this variant if the transaction might otherwise be read-only, to avoid unnecessary consumption of an XID.)
Returns the current transaction's ID. It will assign a new one if the current transaction does not have one already (because it has not performed any database updates).

Returns the current value of the setting setting_name. If there is no such setting, current_setting throws an error unless missing_ok is supplied and is true. This function corresponds to the SQL command SHOW.
Returns the current write-ahead log flush location (see notes below).
Returns the current write-ahead log insert location (see notes below).
Returns the current write-ahead log write location (see notes below).
Returns the distance between two cubes. If both cubes are points, this is the normal distance function.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la distancia entre dos cubos.Si ambos cubos son puntos,esta es la función de distancia normal.

trans-unit.source: Returns the entire file path name (relative to the database cluster's data directory, PGDATA) of the relation.
Returns the file system path that this tablespace is located in.
Returns the first JSON item returned by the JSON path for the specified JSON value. Returns NULL if there are no results. The optional vars and silent arguments act the same as for jsonb_path_exists.
Returns the first value of the input enum type
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el primer valor del tipo de entrada enum

trans-unit.source: Returns the first value of the input enum type.

Returns the fraction (0–1) of the asynchronous notification queue's maximum size that is currently occupied by notifications that are waiting to be processed. See LISTEN and NOTIFY for more information.
Returns the full issuer name of the current client certificate, converting character data into the current database encoding. Encoding conversions are handled the same as for ssl_client_dn.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el nombre completo del emisor del certificado de cliente actual, convirtiendo los datos de caracteres en la codificación de la base de datos actual. Las conversiones de codificación se manejan de la misma manera que para ssl_client_dn .

trans-unit.source: Returns the full subject of the current client certificate, converting character data into the current database encoding. It is assumed that if you use non-ASCII characters in the certificate names, your database is able to represent these characters, too. If your database uses the SQL_ASCII encoding, non-ASCII characters in the name will be represented as UTF-8 sequences.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el asunto completo del certificado de cliente actual,convirtiendo los datos de los caracteres en la codificación de la base de datos actual.Se supone que si utiliza caracteres no ASCII en los nombres de los certificados,su base de datos también puede representar estos caracteres.Si su base de datos utiliza la codificación SQL_ASCII,los caracteres no ASCII del nombre se representarán como secuencias UTF-8.

trans-unit.source: Returns the given string suitably quoted to be used as a string literal in an SQL statement string. Embedded single-quotes and backslashes are properly doubled. Note that quote_literal returns null on null input; if the argument might be null, quote_nullable is often more suitable. See also Example 42.1.

Returns the given string suitably quoted to be used as a string literal in an SQL statement string; or, if the argument is null, returns NULL. Embedded single-quotes and backslashes are properly doubled. See also Example 42.1.

Returns the given string suitably quoted to be used as an identifier in an SQL statement string. Quotes are added only if necessary (i.e., if the string contains non-identifier characters or would be case-folded). Embedded quotes are properly doubled. See also Example 42.1.
Returns the great circle distance between two points on the surface of the Earth.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la gran distancia circular entre dos puntos de la superficie de la Tierra.

trans-unit.source: Returns the last value of the input enum type
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el último valor del tipo de entrada enum

trans-unit.source: Returns the last value of the input enum type.

Returns the last write-ahead log location that has been received and synced to disk by streaming replication. While streaming replication is in progress this will increase monotonically. If recovery has completed then this will remain static at the location of the last WAL record received and synced to disk during recovery. If streaming replication is disabled, or if it has not yet started, the function returns NULL.

Returns the last write-ahead log location that has been replayed during recovery. If recovery is still in progress this will increase monotonically. If recovery has completed then this will remain static at the location of the last WAL record applied during recovery. When the server has been started normally without recovery, the function returns NULL.
Returns the latitude in degrees of a point on the surface of the Earth.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la latitud en grados de un punto de la superficie de la Tierra.

trans-unit.source: Returns the length of the requested array dimension.
Returns the location of a point on the surface of the Earth given its latitude (argument 1) and longitude (argument 2) in degrees.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la ubicación de un punto en la superficie de la Tierra dada su latitud (argumento 1)y longitud (argumento 2)en grados.

trans-unit.source: Returns the longitude in degrees of a point on the surface of the Earth.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la longitud en grados de un punto de la superficie de la Tierra.

trans-unit.source: Returns the lower bound of the requested array dimension.
Returns the name of the cipher used for the SSL connection (e.g. DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el nombre del cifrado utilizado para la conexión SSL (por ejemplo,DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA).

trans-unit.source: Returns the name of the cipher used for the SSL connection (e.g., DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA).

Returns the name of the collation of the value that is passed to it. The value is quoted and schema-qualified if necessary. If no collation was derived for the argument expression, then NULL is returned. If the argument is not of a collatable data type, then an error is raised.
Returns the name of the current database. (Databases are called “catalogs” in the SQL standard, so current_catalog is the standard's spelling.)
Returns the name of the protocol used for the SSL connection (e.g. TLSv1.0 TLSv1.1, or TLSv1.2).
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el nombre del protocolo utilizado para la conexión SSL (por ejemplo,TLSv1.0 TLSv1.1,o TLSv1.2).

trans-unit.source: Returns the name of the protocol used for the SSL connection (e.g., TLSv1.0, TLSv1.1, or TLSv1.2).

Returns the name of the schema that is first in the search path (or a null value if the search path is empty). This is the schema that will be used for any tables or other named objects that are created without specifying a target schema.

Returns the name of the sequence associated with a column, or NULL if no sequence is associated with the column. If the column is an identity column, the associated sequence is the sequence internally created for that column. For columns created using one of the serial types (serial, smallserial, bigserial), it is the sequence created for that serial column definition. In the latter case, the association can be modified or removed with ALTER SEQUENCE OWNED BY. (This function probably should have been called pg_get_owned_sequence; its current name reflects the fact that it has historically been used with serial-type columns.) The first parameter is a table name with optional schema, and the second parameter is a column name. Because the first parameter potentially contains both schema and table names, it is parsed per usual SQL rules, meaning it is lower-cased by default. The second parameter, being just a column name, is treated literally and so has its case preserved. The result is suitably formatted for passing to the sequence functions (see Section 9.17).

Returns the name, size, and last modification time (mtime) of each ordinary file in the server's WAL archive status directory (pg_wal/archive_status). Filenames beginning with a dot, directories, and other special files are excluded.
Returns the name, size, and last modification time (mtime) of each ordinary file in the server's log directory. Filenames beginning with a dot, directories, and other special files are excluded.

Returns the name, size, and last modification time (mtime) of each ordinary file in the server's write-ahead log (WAL) directory. Filenames beginning with a dot, directories, and other special files are excluded.

Returns the name, size, and last modification time (mtime) of each ordinary file in the temporary file directory for the specified tablespace. If tablespace is not provided, the pg_default tablespace is examined. Filenames beginning with a dot, directories, and other special files are excluded.

Returns the names of all files (and directories and other special files) in the specified directory. The include_dot_dirs parameter indicates whether “.” and “..” are to be included in the result set; the default is to exclude them. Including them can be useful when missing_ok is true, to distinguish an empty directory from a non-existent directory.
Returns the negation (NOT) of the given query.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la negación (NO)de la consulta dada.

trans-unit.source: Returns the netmask length in bits.
Returns the network part of the address, zeroing out whatever is to the right of the netmask. (This is equivalent to casting the value to cidr.)
Returns the number of all-visible pages and the number of all-frozen pages in the relation according to the visibility map.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el número de páginas totalmente visibles y el número de páginas totalmente congeladas en la relación según el mapa de visibilidad.

trans-unit.source: Returns the number of bytes in the binary string.
Returns the number of characters in the binary string, assuming that it is text in the given encoding.
Returns the number of characters in the string.
Returns the number of dimensions of the array.
Returns the number of dimensions of the cube.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el número de dimensiones del cubo.

trans-unit.source: Returns the number of elements in the array.
Returns the number of elements in the outermost JSON array.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el número de elementos en la matriz JSON más exterior.

trans-unit.source: Returns the number of elements in the top-level JSON array.
Returns the number of lexemes in the tsvector.
Returns the number of lexemes plus operators in the tsquery.
Returns the number of lexemes stored in the vector.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el número de lexemas almacenados en el vector.

trans-unit.source: Returns the number of nodes (lexemes plus operators) in a tsquery. This function is useful to determine if the query is meaningful (returns > 0), or contains only stop words (returns 0). Examples:
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el número de nodos (lexemas más operadores) en un tsquery . Esta función es útil para determinar si la query es significativa (devuelve> 0) o contiene solo palabras vacías (devuelve 0). Ejemplos:

trans-unit.source: Returns the number of non-null arguments.
Returns the number of null arguments.
Returns the number of points. Available for path, polygon.

Returns the number of the bucket in which operand falls given an array listing the lower bounds of the buckets. Returns 0 for an input less than the first lower bound. operand and the array elements can be of any type having standard comparison operators. The thresholds array must be sorted, smallest first, or unexpected results will be obtained.
Returns the number of the bucket in which operand falls in a histogram having count equal-width buckets spanning the range low to high. Returns 0 or count+1 for an input outside that range.
Returns the number of the current row within its partition, counting from 1.

Returns the numeric code of the first character of the argument. In UTF8 encoding, returns the Unicode code point of the character. In other multibyte encodings, the argument must be an ASCII character.

Returns the path name of the log file currently in use by the logging collector. The path includes the log_directory directory and the individual log file name. The result is NULL if the logging collector is disabled. When multiple log files exist, each in a different format, pg_current_logfile without an argument returns the path of the file having the first format found in the ordered list: stderr, csvlog. NULL is returned if no log file has any of these formats. To request information about a specific log file format, supply either csvlog or stderr as the value of the optional parameter. The result is NULL if the log format requested is not configured in log_destination. The result reflects the contents of the current_logfiles file.

Returns the portion of a tsquery that can be used for searching an index. This function is useful for detecting unindexable queries, for example those containing only stop words or only negated terms. For example:
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la parte de un tsquery que se puede usar para buscar un índice. Esta función es útil para detectar consultas no indexables, por ejemplo, aquellas que contienen solo palabras vacías o solo términos negados. Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Returns the process ID of the server process attached to the current session.
Returns the process ID of this backend.

Returns the range between the two given enum values, as an ordered array. The values must be from the same enum type. If the first parameter is null, the result will start with the first value of the enum type. If the second parameter is null, the result will end with the last value of the enum type.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el rango entre los dos valores numéricos dados,como una matriz ordenada.Los valores deben ser del mismo tipo de enum.Si el primer parámetro es nulo,el resultado comenzará con el primer valor del tipo enum.Si el segundo parámetro es nulo,el resultado terminará con el último valor del enum type.

trans-unit.source: Returns the rank of the current row, with gaps; that is, the row_number of the first row in its peer group.
Returns the rank of the current row, without gaps; this function effectively counts peer groups.
Returns the relative rank of the current row, that is (rank - 1) / (total partition rows - 1). The value thus ranges from 0 to 1 inclusive.
Returns the replay location for the given replication origin. The parameter flush determines whether the corresponding local transaction will be guaranteed to have been flushed to disk or not.

Returns the replay location for the replication origin selected in the current session. The parameter flush determines whether the corresponding local transaction will be guaranteed to have been flushed to disk or not.
Returns the result of JSON path predicate check for the specified JSON value. Only the first item of the result is taken into account. If the result is not Boolean, then null is returned.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el resultado de la verificación del predicado de la ruta JSON para el valor JSON especificado. Solo se tiene en cuenta el primer elemento del resultado. Si el resultado no es booleano, se devuelve un null .

trans-unit.source: Returns the result of a JSON path predicate check for the specified JSON value. Only the first item of the result is taken into account. If the result is not Boolean, then NULL is returned.

Returns the result of a JSON path predicate check for the specified JSON value. Only the first item of the result is taken into account. If the result is not Boolean, then NULL is returned. The optional vars and silent arguments act the same as for jsonb_path_exists.
Returns the row as a JSON object. Line feeds will be added between level-1 elements if pretty_bool is true.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la fila como un objeto JSON. Se agregarán pretty_bool línea entre los elementos de nivel 1 si pretty_bool es verdadero.

trans-unit.source: Returns the session user's name.

Returns the set of OIDs of databases that have objects stored in the specified tablespace. If this function returns any rows, the tablespace is not empty and cannot be dropped. To identify the specific objects populating the tablespace, you will need to connect to the database(s) identified by pg_tablespace_databases and query their pg_class catalogs.
Returns the set of currently active backend ID numbers (from 1 to the number of active backends).
Returns the set of in-progress transaction IDs contained in a snapshot.
Returns the set of keys in the top-level JSON object.
Returns the set of names of asynchronous notification channels that the current session is listening to.
Returns the set of storage options represented by a value from pg_class.reloptions or pg_attribute.attoptions.
Returns the start time of the current on-line exclusive backup if one is in progress, otherwise NULL.

Returns the subscript of the first occurrence of the second argument in the array, or NULL if it's not present. If the third argument is given, the search begins at that subscript. The array must be one-dimensional. Comparisons are done using IS NOT DISTINCT FROM semantics, so it is possible to search for NULL.
Returns the text of the currently executing query, as submitted by the client (which might contain more than one statement).
Returns the text of this backend's most recent query.

Returns the time stamp of the last transaction replayed during recovery. This is the time at which the commit or abort WAL record for that transaction was generated on the primary. If no transactions have been replayed during recovery, the function returns NULL. Otherwise, if recovery is still in progress this will increase monotonically. If recovery has completed then this will remain static at the time of the last transaction applied during recovery. When the server has been started normally without recovery, the function returns NULL.
Returns the time when the backend's current transaction was started.
Returns the time when the backend's most recent query was started.

Returns the time when the server configuration files were last loaded. If the current session was alive at the time, this will be the time when the session itself re-read the configuration files (so the reading will vary a little in different sessions). Otherwise it is the time when the postmaster process re-read the configuration files.
Returns the time when the server started.
Returns the time when this process was started.
Returns the timestamp of the current statistics snapshot
trans-unit.target: Devuelve la marca de tiempo de la instantánea de las estadísticas actuales

trans-unit.source: Returns the timestamp of the current statistics snapshot.
Returns the top-most parent of the partition tree to which the given relation belongs. Returns NULL if the relation does not exist or is not a partition or partitioned table.
Returns the total number of elements in the array, or 0 if the array is empty.
Returns the transaction ID and commit timestamp of the latest committed transaction.
Returns the type of the outermost JSON value as a text string. Possible types are object, array, string, number, boolean, and null.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el tipo del valor JSON más externo como una cadena de texto. Los tipos posibles son object , array , string , number , boolean o y null .

trans-unit.source: Returns the type of the top-level JSON value as a text string. Possible types are object, array, string, number, boolean, and null. (The null result should not be confused with a SQL NULL; see the examples.)
Returns the unabbreviated IP address and netmask length as text. (This has the same result as an explicit cast to text.)
Returns the upper bound of the requested array dimension.
Returns the user name of the current execution context.

Returns the value as json or jsonb. Arrays and composites are converted (recursively) to arrays and objects; otherwise, if there is a cast from the type to json, the cast function will be used to perform the conversion; otherwise, a scalar value is produced. For any scalar type other than a number, a Boolean, or a null value, the text representation will be used, in such a fashion that it is a valid json or jsonb value.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve el valor como json o jsonb . Las matrices y los compuestos se convierten (recursivamente) en matrices y objetos; de lo contrario, si hay una conversión del tipo a json , la función de conversión se utilizará para realizar la conversión; de lo contrario, se produce un valor escalar. Para cualquier tipo escalar que no sea un número, un valor booleano o nulo, se utilizará la representación de texto, de tal manera que sea un valor json o jsonb válido .

trans-unit.source: Returns the value most recently obtained by nextval for this sequence in the current session. (An error is reported if nextval has never been called for this sequence in this session.) Because this is returning a session-local value, it gives a predictable answer whether or not other sessions have executed nextval since the current session did.

Returns the value most recently returned by nextval in the current session. This function is identical to currval, except that instead of taking the sequence name as an argument it refers to whichever sequence nextval was most recently applied to in the current session. It is an error to call lastval if nextval has not yet been called in the current session.
Returns the wait event name if this backend is currently waiting, otherwise NULL. See Table 27.5 through Table 27.13.
Returns the wait event type name if this backend is currently waiting, otherwise NULL. See Table 27.4 for details.
Returns true if string starts with prefix.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si la string comienza con prefix .

trans-unit.source: Returns true if a JIT compiler extension is available (see Chapter 31) and the jit configuration parameter is set to on.
Returns true if a leaf tuple satisfies a query.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si una tupla de hojas satisface una consulta.

trans-unit.source: Returns true if a replication origin has been selected in the current session.
Returns true if all non-null input values are true, otherwise false.

Returns true if an indexed item satisfies the query operator with strategy number n (or might satisfy it, if the recheck indication is returned). This function does not have direct access to the indexed item's value, since GIN does not store items explicitly. Rather, what is available is knowledge about which key values extracted from the query appear in a given indexed item. The check array has length nkeys, which is the same as the number of keys previously returned by extractQuery for this query datum. Each element of the check array is true if the indexed item contains the corresponding query key, i.e., if (check[i] == true) the i-th key of the extractQuery result array is present in the indexed item. The original query datum is passed in case the consistent method needs to consult it, and so are the queryKeys[] and nullFlags[] arrays previously returned by extractQuery. extra_data is the extra-data array returned by extractQuery, or NULL if none.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si un elemento indexado satisface al operador de consulta con el número de estrategia n (o podría satisfacerlo, si se devuelve la indicación de volver a comprobar). Esta función no tiene acceso directo al valor del artículo indexado, ya que GIN no almacena artículos explícitamente. Más bien, lo que está disponible es conocimiento sobre qué valores clave extraídos de la consulta aparecen en un elemento indexado dado. La matriz de check tiene una longitud nkeys , que es la misma que la cantidad de claves devueltas anteriormente por extractQuery para este dato de query . Cada elemento de la matriz de check es verdadero si el elemento indexado contiene la clave de consulta correspondiente, es decir, si (verifique [i] == verdadero) la clave i-ésima de extractQuery La matriz de resultados está presente en el elemento indexado. El dato de query original se pasa en caso de que el método consistent e necesite consultarlo, y también lo son las queryKeys[] y nullFlags[] devueltas previamente por extractQuery . extra_data es la matriz de datos extra devuelta por extractQuery , o NULL si no hay ninguno.

trans-unit.source: Returns true if an on-line exclusive backup is in progress.
Returns true if any non-null input value is true, otherwise false.
Returns true if current client has presented a valid SSL client certificate to the server, and false otherwise. (The server might or might not be configured to require a client certificate.)
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si el cliente actual ha presentado un certificado de cliente SSL válido al servidor,y falso en caso contrario.(El servidor puede o no estar configurado para requerir un certificado de cliente).

trans-unit.source: Returns true if current connection to server uses SSL, and false otherwise.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si la conexión actual al servidor utiliza SSL,y falso en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: Returns true if recovery is paused.
Returns true if recovery is still in progress.
Returns true if the cube is a point, that is, the two defining corners are the same.
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si el cubo es un punto,es decir,las dos esquinas que lo definen son las mismas.

trans-unit.source: Returns true if the given OID is the OID of another session's temporary schema. (This can be useful, for example, to exclude other sessions' temporary tables from a catalog display.)
Returns true if two index entries are identical, false otherwise. (An “index entry” is a value of the index's storage type, not necessarily the original indexed column's type.)
trans-unit.target: Devuelve verdadero si dos entradas de índice son idénticas, falso en caso contrario. (Una "entrada de índice" es un valor del tipo de almacenamiento del índice, no necesariamente el tipo de columna indexada original).

trans-unit.source: Returns value associated with given key, or NULL if not present.
Returns values associated with given keys, or NULL if not present.
Returns whether the ScanKey is consistent with the given indexed values for a range. The attribute number to use is passed as part of the scan key.

Además, es posible comparar dos valores de fila o probar una fila con IS NULL o IS NOT NULL , por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Row identifier
trans-unit.target: Identificador de fila

trans-unit.source: Row security can also be disabled with the ALTER TABLE command. Disabling row security does not remove any policies that are defined on the table; they are simply ignored. Then all rows in the table are visible and modifiable, subject to the standard SQL privileges system.
trans-unit.target: La seguridad de filas también se puede desactivar con el comando ALTER TABLE . La desactivación de la seguridad de filas no elimina ninguna política definida en la tabla; simplemente se ignoran. Entonces, todas las filas de la tabla son visibles y modificables, sujeto al sistema estándar de privilegios SQL.

trans-unit.source: Row security policies can be specific to commands, or to roles, or to both. A policy can be specified to apply to ALL commands, or to SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE. Multiple roles can be assigned to a given policy, and normal role membership and inheritance rules apply.
trans-unit.target: Las políticas de seguridad de filas pueden ser específicas para comandos, roles o ambos. Se puede especificar una política para que se aplique a ALL comandos o para SELECT , INSERT AR , UPDATE o DELETE . Se pueden asignar varios roles a una política determinada y se aplican las reglas normales de herencia y pertenencia al rol.

trans-unit.source: Row updates or deletions caused by foreign-key enforcement actions, such as ON UPDATE CASCADE or ON DELETE SET NULL, are treated as part of the SQL command that caused them (note that such actions are never deferred). Relevant triggers on the affected table will be fired, so that this provides another way in which a SQL command might fire triggers not directly matching its type. In simple cases, triggers that request transition relations will see all changes caused in their table by a single original SQL command as a single transition relation. However, there are cases in which the presence of an AFTER ROW trigger that requests transition relations will cause the foreign-key enforcement actions triggered by a single SQL command to be split into multiple steps, each with its own transition relation(s). In such cases, any statement-level triggers that are present will be fired once per creation of a transition relation set, ensuring that the triggers see each affected row in a transition relation once and only once.
trans-unit.target: Las actualizaciones o eliminaciones de filas causadas por acciones de aplicación de claves externas, como ON UPDATE CASCADE o ON DELETE SET NULL , se tratan como parte del comando SQL que las causó (tenga en cuenta que tales acciones nunca se aplazan). Se dispararán los disparadores relevantes en la tabla afectada, por lo que esto proporciona otra forma en la que un comando SQL podría disparar disparadores que no coincidan directamente con su tipo. En casos simples, los disparadores que solicitan relaciones de transición verán todos los cambios causados ​​en su tabla por un solo comando SQL original como una sola relación de transición. Sin embargo, hay casos en los que la presencia de un AFTER ROW El activador que solicita relaciones de transición hará que las acciones de aplicación de clave externa activadas por un solo comando SQL se dividan en varios pasos, cada uno con su (s) propia (s) relación (es) de transición. En tales casos, cualquier activador de nivel de instrucción que esté presente se activará una vez por creación de un conjunto de relaciones de transición, lo que garantiza que los activadores vean cada fila afectada en una relación de transición una vez y solo una vez.

trans-unit.source: Running DROP DATABASE or ALTER DATABASE ... SET TABLESPACE on the primary will generate a WAL entry that will cause all users connected to that database on the standby to be forcibly disconnected. This action occurs immediately, whatever the setting of max_standby_streaming_delay. Note that ALTER DATABASE ... RENAME does not disconnect users, which in most cases will go unnoticed, though might in some cases cause a program confusion if it depends in some way upon database name.
trans-unit.target: La ejecución de DROP DATABASE o ALTER DATABASE ... SET TABLESPACE en el primario generará una entrada WAL que hará que todos los usuarios conectados a esa base de datos en el modo de espera se desconecten a la fuerza. Esta acción se produce de inmediato, sea cual sea la configuración de max_standby_streaming_delay . Tenga en cuenta que ALTER DATABASE ... RENAME no desconecta a los usuarios, lo que en la mayoría de los casos pasará desapercibido, aunque en algunos casos puede causar confusión en el programa si depende de alguna manera del nombre de la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: Running queries in hot standby mode is similar to normal query operation, though there are several usage and administrative differences explained below.

trans-unit.source: SCRAM with channel binding prevents such man-in-the-middle attacks by mixing the signature of the server's certificate into the transmitted password hash. trans-unit.source: SELinux access control decisions are made using security labels, which are represented by strings such as system_u:object_r:sepgsql_table_t:s0. Each access control decision involves two labels: the label of the subject attempting to perform the action, and the label of the object on which the operation is to be performed. Since these labels can be applied to any sort of object, access control decisions for objects stored within the database can be (and, with this module, are) subjected to the same general criteria used for objects of any other type, such as files. This design is intended to allow a centralized security policy to protect information assets independent of the particulars of how those assets are stored.
trans-unit.target: Las decisiones de control de acceso de SELinux se toman mediante etiquetas de seguridad, que están representadas por cadenas como system_u:object_r:sepgsql_table_t:s0 . Cada decisión de control de acceso implica dos etiquetas: la etiqueta del sujeto que intenta realizar la acción y la etiqueta del objeto en el que se realizará la operación. Dado que estas etiquetas se pueden aplicar a cualquier tipo de objeto, las decisiones de control de acceso para objetos almacenados dentro de la base de datos pueden estar (y, con este módulo, están) sujetas a los mismos criterios generales utilizados para objetos de cualquier otro tipo, como archivos. Este diseño está destinado a permitir una política de seguridad centralizada para proteger los activos de información independientemente de los detalles de cómo se almacenan esos activos.

trans-unit.source: SELinux defines several permissions to control common operations for each object type; such as creation, alter, drop and relabel of security label. In addition, several object types have special permissions to control their characteristic operations; such as addition or deletion of name entries within a particular schema.
trans-unit.target: SELinux definieert verschillende machtigingen om gemeenschappelijke bewerkingen voor elk objecttype aan te sturen;zoals het aanmaken,wijzigen,laten vallen en herlabelen van beveiligingslabels.Daarnaast hebben verschillende objecttypes speciale permissies om hun kenmerkende bewerkingen aan te sturen;zoals het toevoegen of verwijderen van naamsvermeldingen binnen een bepaald schema.

trans-unit.source: SP-GiST Indexes: Implementation

trans-unit.source: SP-GiST indexes, like GiST indexes, offer an infrastructure that supports various kinds of searches. SP-GiST permits implementation of a wide range of different non-balanced disk-based data structures, such as quadtrees, k-d trees, and radix trees (tries). As an example, the standard distribution of PostgreSQL includes SP-GiST operator classes for two-dimensional points, which support indexed queries using these operators:
trans-unit.target: SP-GiST-indexen,zoals GiST-indexen,bieden een infrastructuur die verschillende soorten zoekopdrachten ondersteunt.SP-GiST maakt de implementatie mogelijk van een breed scala aan verschillende niet-gebalanceerde schijfgebaseerde datastructuren,zoals kwadranten,k-d-bomen en radix-bomen (tries).De standaard distributie van PostgreSQL bevat bijvoorbeeld SP-GiST operatorklassen voor tweedimensionale punten,die geïndexeerde zoekopdrachten met behulp van deze operatoren ondersteunen:

trans-unit.source: SP-GiST is an abbreviation for space-partitioned GiST. SP-GiST supports partitioned search trees, which facilitate development of a wide range of different non-balanced data structures, such as quad-trees, k-d trees, and radix trees (tries). The common feature of these structures is that they repeatedly divide the search space into partitions that need not be of equal size. Searches that are well matched to the partitioning rule can be very fast.
trans-unit.target: SP-GiST is een afkorting voor space-partitioned GiST.SP-GiST ondersteunt gepartitioneerde zoekbomen,die de ontwikkeling van een breed scala aan verschillende niet-gebalanceerde datastructuren,zoals kwadraatbomen,k-d-bomen en radix-bomen (tries)vergemakkelijken.Het gemeenschappelijke kenmerk van deze structuren is dat ze de zoekruimte herhaaldelijk verdelen in partities die niet even groot hoeven te zijn.Zoekopdrachten die goed zijn afgestemd op de verdelingsregel kunnen zeer snel zijn.

trans-unit.source: SP-GiST offers an interface with a high level of abstraction, requiring the access method developer to implement only methods specific to a given data type. The SP-GiST core is responsible for efficient disk mapping and searching the tree structure. It also takes care of concurrency and logging considerations.
trans-unit.target: SP-GiST biedt een interface met een hoog abstractieniveau,waarbij de ontwikkelaar van de toegangsmethode alleen methoden moet implementeren die specifiek zijn voor een bepaald datatype.De SP-GiST kern is verantwoordelijk voor het efficiënt in kaart brengen van schijven en het doorzoeken van de boomstructuur.Het zorgt ook voor de gelijktijdigheid en het loggen van de gegevens.

trans-unit.source: SQL INSERT and UPDATE statements place the results of expressions into a table. The expressions in the statement must be matched up with, and perhaps converted to, the types of the target columns.
trans-unit.target: Las INSERT SQL INSERT y UPDATE colocan los resultados de las expresiones en una tabla. Las expresiones de la declaración deben coincidir con los tipos de las columnas de destino y quizás convertirse en ellos.

trans-unit.source: SQL NULL is a different concept
trans-unit.target: SQL NULL es un concepto diferente

trans-unit.source: SQL UNION constructs must match up possibly dissimilar types to become a single result set. The resolution algorithm is applied separately to each output column of a union query. The INTERSECT and EXCEPT constructs resolve dissimilar types in the same way as UNION. Some other constructs, including CASE, ARRAY, VALUES, and the GREATEST and LEAST functions, use the identical algorithm to match up their component expressions and select a result data type.

SQL UNION constructs must match up possibly dissimilar types to become a single result set. The resolution algorithm is applied separately to each output column of a union query. The INTERSECT and EXCEPT constructs resolve dissimilar types in the same way as UNION. The CASE, ARRAY, VALUES, GREATEST and LEAST constructs use the identical algorithm to match up their component expressions and select a result data type.
trans-unit.target: Las construcciones SQL UNION deben coincidir con tipos posiblemente diferentes para convertirse en un único conjunto de resultados. El algoritmo de resolución se aplica por separado a cada columna de salida de una consulta conjunta. Las construcciones INTERSECT y EXCEPT resuelven tipos diferentes de la misma forma que UNION . Las construcciones CASE , ARRAY , VALUES , GREATEST y LEAST utilizan el algoritmo idéntico para hacer coincidir sus expresiones componentes y seleccionar un tipo de datos de resultado.
